name: mental_model
description: Apply structured mental models to problem-solving. Select a model and define your problem.

modelName.description: Model to apply: first_principles (break down to basics), opportunity_cost (what you give up), error_propagation (how errors spread), rubber_duck (explain problem aloud), pareto_principle (80/20 rule), occams_razor (simplest explanation), regression_to_mean (extremes normalize), confirmation_bias (seeking confirming evidence), normal_distribution (bell curve), sensitivity_analysis (parameter impact), bayes_theorem (update with new evidence), survivorship_bias (seeing only survivors), systems_thinking (interconnections), thought_experiment (hypothetical scenario), hanlons_razor (not malice but incompetence), proximate_ultimate_causation (immediate vs root causes), zero_sum_game (win/lose tradeoffs), loss_aversion (avoiding losses), sunk_cost (ignoring past investments), lateral_thinking (indirect approach), divergent_thinking (creative options), scientific_method (hypothesis testing), decision_tree (branching choices), scenario_planning (future possibilities), simulation (model outcomes), catalysis (accelerate processes), ecosystem (living systems)

problem.description: The problem to analyze using the selected mental model.
